topComments.author: Mohamed Soliman
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) O templo de Seti I tamb√©m conhecido como o Grande Templo de Abidos √© um dos principais locais hist√≥ricos de Abidos. O templo foi constru√≠do pelo fara√≥ Seti I. Na parte de tr√°s do templo est√° o Osireion. O templo tamb√©m √© not√°vel pelos grafites de Abidos, antigos grafites fen√≠cios e aramaicos encontrados nas paredes do templo.  (Original) The temple of Seti I also known as the Great Temple of Abydos is one of the main historical sites in Abydos. The temple was built by pharaoh Seti I. At the rear of the temple there is the Osireion. The temple is also notable for the Abydos graffiti, ancient Phoenician and Aramaic graffiti found on the temple walls.

topComments.author: sayed ashour
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Cemit√©rio Bahri ‚úçÔ∏è  Bahri foi considerado um dos maiores estadistas durante o reinado de Tutmosis o Primeiro, e sua primeira apari√ß√£o foi no Cabo, sua cidade natal.  Seus t√≠tulos eram governador de Nukhab, governador de Dendara e supervisor de terras agr√≠colas no sul, desde o in√≠cio de Isna at√© Nukh e o escritor habilidoso. Da mesma forma, ele foi chamado de filho do Rei do Rei. N√£o √© surpreendente que, desde os tempos antigos, os pr√≠ncipes do Cabo fossem leais √† casa real e, portanto, continuassem a carregar seus t√≠tulos heredit√°rios.  O cemit√©rio Bahari √© considerado uma das maiores fontes de onde o pesquisador pode obter informa√ß√µes interessantes que nos revelam v√°rios aspectos da vida social, religiosa e pol√≠tica deste per√≠odo em que os reis da XVIII Dinastia come√ßaram a brilhar no pa√≠s e no exterior.  E se olharmos para sua estela f√∫nebre, na qual deixou uma inscri√ß√£o religiosa, √© considerada uma das fontes mais importantes sobre a religi√£o do povo nesta √©poca, especialmente porque nos fornece um novo tipo de documentos que foram registrados pelas grandes pessoas desta fam√≠lia em seus t√∫mulos.  O cemit√©rio de Bahari cont√©m muitas cenas de sua vida privada e da vida governamental, bem como cenas de funerais p√∫blicos, e essas cenas foram trocadas, felizmente, por inscri√ß√µes que as explicam, o que as tornava de grandes vantagens. At√© porque ilumina o quotidiano e as ac√ß√µes das pessoas, incluindo o humor e as doces car√≠cias que encontramos nos documentos daqueles tempos antigos.  ‚¨ÖÔ∏è Em uma cena vemos um marinheiro seguido por seus servos, carregando suas roupas E seus chinelos, cadeira e o equipamento que ele precisa, e as inscri√ß√µes nos dizem Deste ponto de vista ‚úçÔ∏è  Ele examinou o trabalho da temporada de ver√£o e o trabalho da temporada de inverno, e todos os trabalhos realizados nos campos pelo prefeito de Nukhab e pelo prefeito de Dandara, e ele √© quem supervisiona os campos nas terras de ao sul, o escritor e a calculadora de rendimentos Bahri.  ‚¨ÖÔ∏è Ele percebe na cena que um marinheiro est√° esperando por ele, mas algu√©m Seus dois cavalos perderam a paci√™ncia e queriam deixar suas pernas relaxarem, e ele o repreendeu O pol√≠tico, dizendo ‚úçÔ∏è  ‚ÄúFique de p√© e n√£o se mova, e n√£o seja desobediente, √≥ excelente cavalo, √≥ (Pr√≠ncipe) a quem seu mestre ama e de quem o governante se orgulha na frente de cada pessoa‚Äù  ‚¨ÖÔ∏è E ele observa na frente dos meus marinheiros uma cena de semeadura e ara√ß√£o, e ele v√™ dois arados Os touros os puxaram como de costume, mas vemos um arado Um terceiro √© puxado por quatro homens com cordas e trabalhadores que aram Com arados puxados por bois, eles dizem ‚Äú  ‚Äú√â um dia lindo quando a pessoa sente a brisa.  (Original) Bahri Cemetery ‚úçÔ∏è  Bahri was considered one of the greatest statesmen during the reign of Tuthmosis the First, and his first appearance was in the Cape, his hometown.  His titles were Governor of Nukhab, Governor of Dendara, and Supervisor of agricultural lands in the south from the beginning of Isna until Nukh and the skilled writer. Likewise, he was called the King of the King‚Äôs son. It is not surprising that, since ancient times the princes of the Cape were loyal to the royal house and therefore continued to carry their hereditary titles.  The Bahari cemetery is considered one of the largest sources from which the researcher can obtain interesting information that reveals to us several aspects of social, religious and political life in this period when the kings of the Eighteenth Dynasty began to shine in the country and abroad.  And if we look at his funeral stela, on which he left a religious inscription, it is considered one of the most important sources on the religion of the people in this era, especially because it provides us with a new type of documents that were recorded by the great people of this family in their graves.  The cemetery of Bahari contains many scenes of his private life and government life, as well as public funeral scenes, and these scenes have been interchanged, fortunately, with inscriptions explaining them, which made them of great advantages.  Especially because it sheds some light on the daily life and actions of the people, including the humor and sweet caresses that we find in the documents of those ancient times.  ‚¨ÖÔ∏è In a scene we see a sailor followed by his servants, carrying his clothes And his slippers, chair and the equipment that he needs, and the inscriptions tell us From this view ‚úçÔ∏è  He examined the work of the summer season and the work of the winter season, and all the works that were accomplished in the fields by the mayor of Nukhab and the mayor of Dandara, and he is the one who supervises the fields in the lands of the south, the writer and the calculator of yields Bahri.  ‚¨ÖÔ∏è He notices in the scene that a sailor is waiting for him, but someone Her two horses ran out of patience, and wanted to let his legs relax, and he rebuked him The politician, saying ‚úçÔ∏è  ‚ÄúStand and do not move, and do not be disobedient, O excellent horse, O (Prince) whom his master loves, and whom the ruler is proud of in front of every person‚Äù ü§£  ‚¨ÖÔ∏è And he watches in front of my sailors a scene of sowing and plowing, and he sees two plows Bulls pulled them as usual, but we see a plow A third is pulled by four men with ropes and laborers who plow With ox-drawn plows, they say ‚Äú  "It is a beautiful day when a person feels the breeze.
